json_encode:
json_encode

(PHP 5 >= 5.2.0, PECL json >= 1.2.0)
json_encode - Returns the JSON representation of a value
Description:
Description

string json_encode ( mixed $value [, int $options = 0 [, int $depth = 512 ]] )
Returns a string containing the JSON representation of value.
Parameters:
Parameters

  options
      Bitmask consisting of JSON_HEX_QUOT, JSON_HEX_TAG, JSON_HEX_AMP,
      JSON_HEX_APOS, JSON_NUMERIC_CHECK, JSON_PRETTY_PRINT,
      JSON_UNESCAPED_SLASHES, JSON_FORCE_OBJECT, JSON_UNESCAPED_UNICODE. The
      behaviour of these constants is described on the_JSON_constants_page.
  depth
      Set the maximum depth. Must be greater than zero.
Return Values:
Return Values

Returns a JSON encoded string on success or FALSE on failure.
Changelog:
Changelog

Version Description
5.5.0   depth parameter was added.
5.4.0   JSON_PRETTY_PRINT, JSON_UNESCAPED_SLASHES, and JSON_UNESCAPED_UNICODE
        options were added.
5.3.3   JSON_NUMERIC_CHECK option was added.
5.3.0   The options parameter was added.
Notes:
Notes

     Note:
     In the event of a failure to encode, json_last_error() can be used to
     determine the exact nature of the error.
     Note:
     When encoding an array, if the keys are not a continuous numeric
     sequence starting from 0, all keys are encoded as strings, and
     specified explicitly for each key-value pair.
     Note:
     Like the reference JSON encoder, json_encode() will generate JSON
     that is a simple value (that is, neither an object nor an array) if
     given a string, integer, float or boolean as an input value. While
     most decoders will accept these values as valid JSON, some may not,
     as the specification is ambiguous on this point.
     To summarise, always test that your JSON decoder can handle the
     output you generate from json_encode().
See Also:
See Also

    * JsonSerializable
    * json_decode() - Decodes a JSON string
    * json_last_error() - Returns the last error occurred
    * serialize() - Generates a storable representation of a value
